paper_abstract: We illustrate recent progress in developing algorithms for solving the Kohn-Sham problem. Key ingredients of our algorithm include pseudopotentials implemented on a real space grid and the use of damped-Chebyshev polynomial filtered subspace iteration. This procedure allows one to predict electronic properties for many materials across the nano-regime, i.e. from atoms to nanocrystals of sufficient size to replicate bulk properties. We will illustrate this method for large silicon quantum dots. (C) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Algorithms for the evolution of electronic properties in nanocrystals
